In-N-Out donated $40,000 to California Republican Party during Newsom recall campaign

Months before objecting to requirements that its restaurants check customers’ coronavirus vaccination status, fast food chain In-N-Out Burger donated $40,000 to the California Republican Party as it worked to recall Gov. Gavin Newsom in large part over his aggressive pandemic response.

Here’s why light rain is knocking out power for thousands of PG&E customers
When light rain hits dusty, ash-covered power lines, it can create mud and lead to small fires — and power outages, PG&E officials say. But a bigger storm could lead to even more outages on Sunday.

Veteran was found dead in S.F. park ravine. Could conservatorship have helped save him?

The plight of a man wounded in the Marines reveals how challenging it can be for loved ones to find the best care for people who become mentally impaired. It also highlights an intensifying debate about whether California’s laws on conservatorship are too narrow.

Monarch butterflies return to Pacific Grove. This may be the reason for their rebound
Around 2,600 monarch butterflies were counted at Pacific Grove Thursday, after zero were seen at the famed sanctuary last year. The butterfly’s population has declined by 99.9% since the ’80s.
